Brief Introduction: Nasi Lemak is a traditional Malaysian dish that is often considered the national dish. It consists of rice cooked in coconut milk, served with sambal, fried anchovies, and boiled eggs.
Ingredients: [{'Ingredient Name': 'Rice', 'Amount': '2 cups', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Special Notes': 'Use jasmine rice for fragrance.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Coconut Milk', 'Amount': '2 cups', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Special Notes': 'Can use coconut cream for richer taste.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Pandan Leaves', 'Amount': '2', 'Unit': 'leaves', 'Special Notes': 'Adds fragrance to rice.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Sambal', 'Amount': '1 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Spicy chili paste.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Fried Anchovies', 'Amount': '1/2 cup', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Special Notes': 'Crispy fried anchovies.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Boiled Eggs', 'Amount': '2', 'Unit': 'eggs', 'Special Notes': 'Boiled until firm.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Cucumber', 'Amount': '1', 'Unit': 'cucumber', 'Special Notes': 'Sliced thinly.'}]
Step-by-Step Instructions: [{'Step Number': 1, 'Step Title': 'Cook the Rice', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Rinse the rice and cook it in coconut milk and pandan leaves for about 20 minutes.', 'Time Estimate': '20 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of cooking rice'}, {'Step Number': 2, 'Step Title': 'Prepare the Sambal', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Fry chopped onions, garlic, and red chilies in oil until fragrant. Add a pinch of sugar and a tablespoon of tamarind paste for the perfect balance.', 'Time Estimate': '5 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of sambal preparation'}, {'Step Number': 3, 'Step Title': 'Fry the Anchovies', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Fry the anchovies in oil until crispy. Set aside.', 'Time Estimate': '3 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of anchovies frying'}, {'Step Number': 4, 'Step Title': 'Boil the Eggs', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Boil the eggs in water for 10 minutes until firm. Peel and set aside.', 'Time Estimate': '10 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of boiling eggs'}, {'Step Number': 5, 'Step Title': 'Assemble the Nasi Lemak', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Serve the cooked rice with sambal, fried anchovies, sliced cucumber, and a boiled egg.', 'Time Estimate': '2 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of plating'}]
Tips and Tricks: [{'Additional Tips': 'Use fresh pandan leaves for a more aromatic rice.'}, {'Common Mistakes to Avoid': 'Avoid overcooking the rice or the anchovies, as both can turn out mushy or too hard.'}]
Serving Suggestions: [{'Serving Size': '2 servings'}, {'Pairings': 'Great with a hot cup of tea or a refreshing coconut drink.'}]

Brief Introduction: Char Kway Teow is a popular stir-fried noodle dish in Malaysia, featuring flat rice noodles, prawns, eggs, and bean sprouts. Itâ€™s known for its smoky flavor, which comes from stir-frying on high heat.
Ingredients: [{'Ingredient Name': 'Flat Rice Noodles', 'Amount': '200g', 'Unit': 'g', 'Special Notes': 'Ensure noodles are soft and not too dry.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Prawns', 'Amount': '100g', 'Unit': 'g', 'Special Notes': 'Use fresh prawns for the best flavor.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Egg', 'Amount': '1', 'Unit': 'egg', 'Special Notes': 'Beaten and scrambled.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Bean Sprouts', 'Amount': '50g', 'Unit': 'g', 'Special Notes': 'Fresh and crisp.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Garlic', 'Amount': '2 cloves', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Special Notes': 'Minced.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Soy Sauce', 'Amount': '1 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Use dark soy sauce for richer flavor.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Oyster Sauce', 'Amount': '1 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'For umami flavor.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Chives', 'Amount': '2 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Chopped.'}]
Step-by-Step Instructions: [{'Step Number': 1, 'Step Title': 'Prepare the Ingredients', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Peel and devein the prawns, chop garlic, and chives. Set aside the noodles and bean sprouts.', 'Time Estimate': '5 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of preparation'}, {'Step Number': 2, 'Step Title': 'Stir-Fry Garlic and Prawns', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Stir-fry garlic in hot oil for 1-2 minutes, then add prawns and cook until pink.', 'Time Estimate': '3 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of stir-frying prawns'}, {'Step Number': 3, 'Step Title': 'Add Noodles and Sauces', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Add the noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Stir-fry for 2 minutes until evenly coated.', 'Time Estimate': '2 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of adding noodles to pan'}, {'Step Number': 4, 'Step Title': 'Scramble the Egg', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Push the noodles to one side, scramble the egg in the pan, and mix it in with the noodles.', 'Time Estimate': '2 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of scrambling egg'}, {'Step Number': 5, 'Step Title': 'Add Bean Sprouts and Chives', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Add bean sprouts and chives, stir-fry for another minute until the vegetables are tender-crisp.', 'Time Estimate': '2 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of stir-frying with bean sprouts'}]
Tips and Tricks: [{'Additional Tips': 'Stir-fry on high heat to get the signature smoky flavor.'}, {'Common Mistakes to Avoid': 'Donâ€™t overcrowd the pan; this can prevent the noodles from frying properly.'}]

Brief Introduction: Tom Yam Soup is a hot and sour Thai soup typically made with shrimp or other seafood. The flavor profile comes from the combination of lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and chili.
Ingredients: [{'Ingredient Name': 'Lemongrass', 'Amount': '2 stalks', 'Unit': 'stalks', 'Special Notes': 'Bruise the stalks to release flavor.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Kaffir Lime Leaves', 'Amount': '5', 'Unit': 'leaves', 'Special Notes': 'Tear them for more aroma.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Galangal', 'Amount': '3 slices', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Special Notes': 'Can substitute with ginger.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Red Chilies', 'Amount': '4-5', 'Unit': 'chilies', 'Special Notes': "Use bird's eye chilies for more spice."}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Fish Sauce', 'Amount': '3 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Adds salty umami.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Lime Juice', 'Amount': '2 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Adjust to taste.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Mushrooms', 'Amount': '100g', 'Unit': 'g', 'Special Notes': 'Any variety, sliced.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Prawns', 'Amount': '200g', 'Unit': 'g', 'Special Notes': 'Peeled and deveined.'}]
Step-by-Step Instructions: [{'Step Number': 1, 'Step Title': 'Prepare the Broth', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Boil water with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and chilies for 5 minutes.', 'Time Estimate': '5 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of boiling broth'}, {'Step Number': 2, 'Step Title': 'Add Fish Sauce and Lime Juice', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Stir in fish sauce and lime juice, adjusting to taste.', 'Time Estimate': '2 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of adding sauces'}, {'Step Number': 3, 'Step Title': 'Add Mushrooms and Prawns', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Add mushrooms and prawns to the broth. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until prawns are pink.', 'Time Estimate': '5 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of adding prawns'}, {'Step Number': 4, 'Step Title': 'Serve the Soup', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Serve hot, garnished with extra lime leaves and cilantro.', 'Time Estimate': '1 minute', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of serving soup'}]
Tips and Tricks: [{'Additional Tips': 'For a deeper flavor, let the broth simmer longer before adding the prawns.'}, {'Common Mistakes to Avoid': 'Donâ€™t overcook the prawns, as they can turn rubbery.'}]
Serving Suggestions: [{'Serving Size': '2 servings'}, {'Pairings': 'Serve with a side of jasmine rice or fried noodles.'}]

Brief Introduction: Roti John is a popular Malaysian street food. This sandwich is filled with minced meat, eggs, and sauces, then grilled to crispy perfection.
Ingredients: [{'Ingredient Name': 'Bread', 'Amount': '4 slices', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Special Notes': 'Choose long baguette-style bread.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Minced Beef', 'Amount': '200g', 'Unit': 'g', 'Special Notes': 'You can substitute with chicken or lamb.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Onion', 'Amount': '1', 'Unit': 'onion', 'Special Notes': 'Chopped.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Egg', 'Amount': '2', 'Unit': 'egg', 'Special Notes': 'Beaten.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Mayonnaise', 'Amount': '2 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'For creamy flavor.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Chili Sauce', 'Amount': '1 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Can use tomato sauce as an alternative.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Butter', 'Amount': '1 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'For toasting the bread.'}]
Step-by-Step Instructions: [{'Step Number': 1, 'Step Title': 'Prepare the Minced Meat', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Fry chopped onions and minced beef until browned. Set aside.', 'Time Estimate': '5 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of frying beef'}, {'Step Number': 2, 'Step Title': 'Toast the Bread', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Toast the bread slices with butter in a pan until golden brown.', 'Time Estimate': '3 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of toasting bread'}, {'Step Number': 3, 'Step Title': 'Assemble the Sandwich', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Spread mayonnaise and chili sauce on the bread. Add the beef mixture, pour over the beaten egg, and grill until crispy.', 'Time Estimate': '7 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of assembling Roti John'}]
Tips and Tricks: [{'Additional Tips': 'For extra flavor, add cheese on top before grilling.'}, {'Common Mistakes to Avoid': 'Avoid using too much sauce as it may make the bread soggy.'}]
Serving Suggestions: [{'Serving Size': '2 servings'}, {'Pairings': 'Serve with a side of fries or a fresh salad.'}]

Brief Introduction: Satay is a popular Southeast Asian dish consisting of skewered and grilled meat, often served with a rich peanut sauce.
Ingredients: [{'Ingredient Name': 'Chicken or Beef', 'Amount': '300g', 'Unit': 'g', 'Special Notes': 'Cut into small pieces.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Peanut Sauce', 'Amount': '3 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Store-bought or homemade.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Soy Sauce', 'Amount': '2 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'For marinating.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Turmeric', 'Amount': '1 tbsp', 'Unit': 'tbsp', 'Special Notes': 'Adds color and flavor.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Garlic', 'Amount': '2 cloves', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Special Notes': 'Minced.'}, {'Ingredient Name': 'Lemongrass', 'Amount': '1 stalk', 'Unit': 'stalk', 'Special Notes': 'Bruised.'}]
Step-by-Step Instructions: [{'Step Number': 1, 'Step Title': 'Marinate the Meat', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Marinate the chicken or beef with soy sauce, turmeric, garlic, and lemongrass for at least 30 minutes.', 'Time Estimate': '30 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of marinating meat'}, {'Step Number': 2, 'Step Title': 'Skewer the Meat', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Thread the marinated meat onto skewers.', 'Time Estimate': '5 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of skewering meat'}, {'Step Number': 3, 'Step Title': 'Grill the Satay', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Grill the skewered meat for 5-7 minutes on each side until fully cooked.', 'Time Estimate': '10 minutes', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of grilling satay'}, {'Step Number': 4, 'Step Title': 'Serve with Peanut Sauce', 'Detailed Instructions': 'Serve the satay with peanut sauce on the side.', 'Time Estimate': '1 minute', 'Visual Aid': 'Image/Video of serving satay'}]
Tips and Tricks: [{'Additional Tips': 'Grill the meat on high heat for the best charred flavor.'}, {'Common Mistakes to Avoid': 'Donâ€™t overcrowd the skewers; it can prevent even cooking.'}]
Serving Suggestions: [{'Serving Size': '2 servings'}, {'Pairings': 'Serve with a side of rice or cucumber salad.'}]

Brief Introduction: Mee Goreng Mamak is a stir-fried noodle dish from the Indian Muslim community in Malaysia. It’s spicy, savory, and often topped with a fried egg.
Ingredients:
{"Ingredient Name": "Yellow Noodles", "Amount": "200g", "Unit": "g", "Special Notes": "Can substitute with egg noodles."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Egg", "Amount": "1", "Unit": "egg", "Special Notes": "Beaten."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Tofu", "Amount": "50g", "Unit": "g", "Special Notes": "Fried and cubed."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Bean Sprouts", "Amount": "50g", "Unit": "g", "Special Notes": "Fresh and crisp."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Soy Sauce", "Amount": "1 tbsp", "Unit": "tbsp", "Special Notes": "Dark soy sauce adds richness."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Chili Paste", "Amount": "1 tbsp", "Unit": "tbsp", "Special Notes": "For spiciness."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Garlic", "Amount": "2 cloves", "Unit": "cloves", "Special Notes": "Minced."}
Step-by-Step Instructions:
{"Step Number": 1, "Step Title": "Prepare the Ingredients", "Detailed Instructions": "Peel and cube tofu, mince garlic, and set aside the noodles and bean sprouts.", "Time Estimate": "5 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of preparation"},
            {"Step Number": 2, "Step Title": "Stir-Fry Garlic and Tofu", "Detailed Instructions": "Stir-fry minced garlic and tofu in oil for 2-3 minutes.", "Time Estimate": "3 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of stir-frying"},
            {"Step Number": 3, "Step Title": "Add Noodles and Sauces", "Detailed Instructions": "Add noodles, soy sauce, and chili paste. Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes.", "Time Estimate": "5 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of noodles in pan"},
            {"Step Number": 4, "Step Title": "Scramble the Egg", "Detailed Instructions": "Push noodles to the side, crack the egg into the pan, and scramble until cooked. Mix in with the noodles.", "Time Estimate": "3 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of scrambling egg"},
Tips and Tricks:
{"Additional Tips": "For a richer flavor, add a dash of oyster sauce."},
            {"Common Mistakes to Avoid": "Don't overcook the noodles, as they can become mushy."}
Serving Suggestions:
{"Serving Size": "2 servings"},
            {"Pairings": "Pair with a refreshing iced drink or a simple cucumber salad."}

Brief Introduction: Ayam Goreng Berempah is a Malaysian-style fried chicken with a fragrant blend of spices, crispy on the outside and juicy inside.
Ingredients:
{"Ingredient Name": "Chicken", "Amount": "1 whole chicken", "Unit": "chicken", "Special Notes": "Cut into pieces."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Turmeric Powder", "Amount": "1 tsp", "Unit": "tsp", "Special Notes": "Adds color and flavor."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Chili Powder", "Amount": "1 tsp", "Unit": "tsp", "Special Notes": "For spiciness."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Ginger Paste", "Amount": "1 tbsp", "Unit": "tbsp", "Special Notes": "Freshly grated."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Garlic", "Amount": "2 cloves", "Unit": "cloves", "Special Notes": "Minced."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Lemon Juice", "Amount": "2 tbsp", "Unit": "tbsp", "Special Notes": "For marinating."},
            {"Ingredient Name": "Salt", "Amount": "1 tsp", "Unit": "tsp", "Special Notes": "To taste."}
Step-by-Step Instructions:
{"Step Number": 1, "Step Title": "Marinate the Chicken", "Detailed Instructions": "Marinate the chicken with turmeric, chili powder, ginger paste, garlic, lemon juice, and salt for at least 30 minutes.", "Time Estimate": "30 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of marinating chicken"},
            {"Step Number": 2, "Step Title": "Heat the Oil", "Detailed Instructions": "Heat oil in a pan for frying.", "Time Estimate": "3 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of heating oil"},
            {"Step Number": 3, "Step Title": "Fry the Chicken", "Detailed Instructions": "Deep fry the marinated chicken for 15-20 minutes until golden brown and crispy.", "Time Estimate": "15-20 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of frying chicken"},
            {"Step Number": 4, "Step Title": "Drain and Serve", "Detailed Instructions": "Drain excess oil and serve the fried chicken hot.", "Time Estimate": "2 minutes", "Visual Aid": "Image/Video of draining fried chicken"}
Tips and Tricks:
{"Additional Tips": "Ensure the oil is hot enough before frying to get a crispy texture."},
            {"Common Mistakes to Avoid": "Don’t overcook the chicken; it can become dry."}
Serving Suggestions:
{"Serving Size": "4 servings"},
            {"Pairings": "Serve with steamed rice or a simple vegetable side dish."}
